---
title: Passive Seated Piriformis Test
keywords:
    - Seated Piriformis Test
---


Identify sciatic nerve irritability related to compression from stretching of the piriformis and other deep hip external rotator muscles [@aptaCurrentConceptsOrthopaedic2024]

- Patient seated [@aptaCurrentConceptsOrthopaedic2024]
- Ipsilateral heel supported and knee placed in full extension [@aptaCurrentConceptsOrthopaedic2024]
- Passively adduct and internally rotate the flexed hip while palpating lateral to the ischium and proximally at the sciatic notch [@aptaCurrentConceptsOrthopaedic2024]

Provocation of at *point of palpation* or *Radiating pain* is positive for Piriformis/ deep hip stabilizer muscle dysfunction and potential sciatic nerve entrapment [@aptaCurrentConceptsOrthopaedic2024]
